name: Air-Fried Salt and Pepper Shrimp
description: If you double this recipe, air-fry in two batches and then use a large (12-inch) skillet to finish the dish.
recipeIngredient: 8  jumbo or colossal shell-on shrimp (about 8 ounces total)
1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt (or 1/2 teaspoon coarse kosher salt)
1 tablespoon plus 1 1/2 teaspoons canola or other neutral oil
1  jalapeno or serrano chile (thinly sliced with seeds intact)

recipeInstructions.text: Using scissors, cut through the shell along the back and then trim the feet from each shrimp. If needed, devein the shrimp. Pat dry with paper towel and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Using scissors, cut through the shell along the back and then trim the feet from each shrimp. If needed, devein the shrimp. Pat dry with paper towel and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, stir together the white pepper, sugar, salt, and starch. Add the shrimp and rub the seasonings into the shrimp; where possible, pry back the shell to season the flesh. Drizzle on 1 1/2 teaspoons oil and toss to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, stir together the white pepper, sugar, salt, and starch. Add the shrimp and rub the seasonings into the shrimp; where possible, pry back the shell to season the flesh. Drizzle on 1 1/2 teaspoons oil and toss to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the air-fryer at 425 to 450°F for 3 to 5 minutes. Meanwhile, arrange the shrimp on the air-fryer wire tray or basket. Leave space around each shrimp to promote heat circulation.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the air-fryer at 425 to 450°F for 3 to 5 minutes. Meanwhile, arrange the shrimp on the air-fryer wire tray or basket. Leave space around each shrimp to promote heat circulation.

recipeInstructions.text: Air-fry the shrimp for about 2 minutes, until crisp on the top side and orange. Turn the shrimp then air-fry for about 90 seconds longer to crisp the other side. Remove from the air-fryer and let sit for several minutes finish cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Air-fry the shrimp for about 2 minutes, until crisp on the top side and orange. Turn the shrimp then air-fry for about 90 seconds longer to crisp the other side. Remove from the air-fryer and let sit for several minutes finish cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the 1 tablespoon oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. When barely shimmering, add the chile and garlic, cook for 15 to 30 seconds, until aromatic. Add the shrimp and cook, stirring to warm the shrimp and coat them with seasonings, about 1 minute. When many of garlic pieces are golden and some have clung onto the shrimp, turn of the heat and transfer to a serving plate along with all the bits in the pan. Serve hot or warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the 1 tablespoon oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. When barely shimmering, add the chile and garlic, cook for 15 to 30 seconds, until aromatic. Add the shrimp and cook, stirring to warm the shrimp and coat them with seasonings, about 1 minute. When many of garlic pieces are golden and some have clung onto the shrimp, turn of the heat and transfer to a serving plate along with all the bits in the pan. Serve hot or warm.

review.reviewBody: I never make shrimp at home, but this recipe seemed so simple I decided to try it out. It was excellent! Thank you so much for the great recipe.
